column4: anyone know of a guide to install nautilus scripts for newbs?
you can use nautilus-script-manager, though it's still cli I believe
also see http://www.gnome.org/learn/users-guide/latest/gosnautilus-440.html
ok thanks illl check that out but where do i find the information on   nautilus-script-manager?

well I just tried it and it only manages nautilus-script-audio-convert and nautilus-script-collection-svn (pacakges you can install) so it's probably not what you want.  Easier to just copy yours to ~/.gnome2/nautilus-scripts
ok will try that too
total brain fart- where can i find the .gnome folder?
or to that folder specificly cause i am not finding it
it's .gnome2.  It is in your home directory but you need to go to  view > show hidden files
thanks
you may need to create nautilus-scripts inside there yourself
i put it in the folder how do i make it so i can use it?
did you make sure it was "executable"?
sorry i am really new to Linux how do i do that?
right click > properties > permisions
on the script or on the ISO?
script
sorry i mean it still nothign
restart nautilus
sorry how do i do that? restart gnome completely? (log off/ctrl+alt+backspace)?
'killall nautilus' ina  terminal should do it
thanks that made it work
k, in the future you should only need to visit ~/.gnome2/nautilus-scripts/ in nautilus for the menu to be updated
